Documentation.long_help: This filter lets the user select coasts from the coasts mask.
Documentation.short_help: Lets the user select coasts from the coasts mask.

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the input to the Threshold filter.

StringVectorProperty.name: mask_field
StringVectorProperty.label: Coast mask:
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: Name of the coast mask field

StringVectorProperty.name: CoastsStatus
StringVectorProperty.label: Mediterranean Sea
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This property contains a list of the coasts of the Mediterranean Sea.

StringVectorProperty.label: Scalars
StringVectorProperty.name: SelectInputScalars
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: The value of this property contains the name of the scalar array from which to perform thresholding.

DoubleVectorProperty.label: Threshold Range
DoubleVectorProperty.name: ThresholdBetween
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: The values of this property specify the upper and lower bounds of the thresholding operation (defaulted to 0.5 and 1).

IntVectorProperty.name: AllScalars
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: If the value of this property is 1, then a cell is only included in the output if the value of the selected array for all its points is within the threshold. This is only relevant when thresholding by a point-centered array.

IntVectorProperty.name: UseContinuousCellRange
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: If off, the vertex scalars are treated as a discrete set. If on, they are treated as a continuous interval over the minimum and maximum. One important "on" use case: When setting lower and upper threshold equal to some value and turning AllScalars off, the results are cells containing the isosurface for that value. WARNING: Whether on or off, for higher order input, the filter will not give accurate results.
